description: Lyric poems -- short, occasional pieces composed in various meters, often concerned with
love and longing -- are the focus of this Latin course. Students translate the vivacious
verse of Catullus, Horace, Tibullus, and Ovid and learn to recognize the features that
make lyric a distinctive genre of Latin poetry.  Offered periodically. Also counts toward ancient
studies and medieval studies majors. Prerequisite: LATIN 231 or equivalent.
